AD_HagCackles.synopsis: A set of different cackles for Ethel to be used in the lair.

PAD_Explore1.synopsis: Players have wandered into the Hag Lair without Ethel being present and are commenting on the creepy environment. This is the first to fire.

AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor.synopsis: This person has been turned into a door and is unable to speak. Sign attached to it.

AD_VictimSign_004.synopsis: This person is trapped in a mirror and mute.

PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.synopsis: You are wearing the mask and the other masked victims do not attack you.

PAD_AtEntrance.synopsis: Combat has started with the hag. She's fled downstairs. You've gone through the fireplace and have just appeared in her lair. Furtive. Looking around for Auntie Ethel.

Victim_001.synopsis:
The dwarf was turned to stone by the hag to stop the spread of an deadly disease - Laduguer's Bite. Little does he know that the hag was the one who cause the disease in the first place.

Should you remove the petrification spell BEFORE the hag is dead, the disease will kill him.

Should you speak to him after the hag is dead, you can figure out that the hag is the one who made him sick in the first place.

AD_VictimSign_005.synopsis: An eyeless woman - dead. One of the hag's victims. You're reading a sign in front of her eyeless body.

VB_BurningCage.synopsis: This occurs when the hag sets the cage on fire.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.synopsis: The hag turns invisible and disappears during the fight.

TalkingDoor.synopsis: The door guarding the entrance to the hag's lair. It's actually transparent and the player can walk through it. It's a cut scene as the door tries to project images onto the player and communicate to them. Pleading with them to leave. The door was a thief that was taken by Ethel and torn to shreds, with the remainder of his body transformed into a door.Much of this is a 'cut scene' as the door projects visions into the player's mind instead of communicating.
TalkingDoor.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel WLD_Main_A- goto -307; 589- Skip through HAG_HagLair_EntranceDouble dialogue- Approach the gnarled door

AD_VictimSign_002.synopsis: A victim holding their own decapitated head in their hands. This is the sign attached to their corpse.

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.synopsis: Triggered during the fight with the hag. She has sent out illusions mimicking Mayrina. The real Mayrina is trying running towards the player. Her voice and mannerisms should be a clue to the player that this is the real Mayrina.

Victim_003_Dead.synopsis: The characters has died and player is using the 'speak with dead' spell. Character is at peace. He lived in fear of his own death. Now that it's happened, he's at peace.

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake.synopsis: These are fired during the fight. It's the hag pretending to be Mayrina.

AD_SummonVictims.synopsis: Auntie Ethel summons victim_001 and victime_003 to aide her in battle.

Victim_005_Dead.synopsis: A dialogue with the corpse of a hag victim with her eyes gouged out. She is happy to be dead-- she lived a terrible life and carried family secrets heavily upon her. Her voice should be meek and delicate. She has borne too much in this life already and is ready to be done.

VB_MayrinaInCage.synopsis: Triggers when the player enters the lair and sees Mayrina trapped in the cage.

Victim_003_Freed.synopsis: This occurs if Lorin survived the fight with the hag. He is dazed and out of it. This is the victim who first say the player as a mind flayer and freaked out. 1) In scenario one, he was never summoned by the hag2) He was summoned and attacked the player and saw the player turn into a mindflayer3) He was summoned and attacked the player but never saw the player as a mind flayer
Victim_003_Freed.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Talk with Lorin. and skip the dialogue.4. SetGlobalOsirisFlag HAG_Hag_State_IsDead5. Talk with Lorin again.RECON  : SetGlobalOsirisFlag HAG_Hag_State_IsDead ACTION  :Talk with Lorin again.

AD_VictimSign_003.synopsis: This person is alive but severely traumatised and hysterical.

AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.synopsis: ADs fire by Mayrina when she is trapped in the cage. In the first set it's when combat has started and she is cheering the player on, in the second set she just wants the player to leave her alone. In the third set the cage is on fire, and in the last the fighting is over but she's still locked in the cage.

AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed.synopsis: This fires during the fight with the player. The player has figured out which illusion is the real hag and hit it.

Victim_004.synopsis: A victim of the hag's. They're trapped inside a mirror.

VB_MirrorScreams.synopsis: Trigger near mirror - someone is trapped inside.

ControlledByMask.synopsis: Hag mode. Player has failed a wisdom save while wearing the mask and the hag has taken over their mind. Cruel and triumphant. The other origin characters realise what has happened.
ControlledByMask.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel WLD_Main_A- goto -307; 589- Skip through HAG_HagLair_EntranceDouble and Skip through HagLair_TalkingDoor if they play- Recruit origin(s) you want to test- Pick up a Whispering Mask and put it on- HAG_HagLair_PutOnMask will play. You'll then enter combat with your party members and this dialogue will play shortly after.

Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.synopsis: This occurs after speaking to the prescient victim in the hag's lair, who sees the player turn into a mind flayer in a vision.

PutOnMask.synopsis: Player put on mask and is hearing auntie's voice telepathically booming around them.
PutOnMask.how_to_trigger: debugbook to the hag lair entrancewalk in to the pit and speak to the hagshe will poof awaymove towards the large dooron your right there is a table with masksequip one of them to trigger

EntranceDouble_StatusFallback.synopsis: This fires when the player enters the victim gallery, if the player can't speak (wildshape, summons, etc.). She appears to taunt them and then vanishes.

AD_VictimSign_001.synopsis: This is the plaque that is attached to the petrified body of one of the hag's victims.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1.synopsis: The fires as Ethel summons illusions of herself to confuse the player.

AD_ViciousMockery.synopsis: The Hag will cast Vicious Mockery on the party in combat. Whoever she targets will be insulted by origin or race. If a character is targeted multiple times, another insult in the chain will be used.

AD_Victim_003.synopsis: This is a victim of the hag. He was cursed to see the future - he's severely traumatised. In the first AD he's been summoned to fight by the hag. In the rest, he's curled up ont he ground and talking to himself. Severely traumatised.

AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.synopsis: The hag assumes the form of Mayrina in the boss fight. The brothers are able to tell who is Mayrina and who is the hag.

AD_DoubleDied.synopsis: This fires during the fight with the hag. She's created doubles of herself and the player has attacked the double - missing her. She's taunting them.

EntranceDouble.synopsis: This fires when the player enters the victim gallery, She appears to taunt them and then vanishes.

Victim_001_Dead.synopsis: Dialogue with dead hag victim using Speak with Dead. He's relieved to be 'free' at last after haivng lived a life petrified/ afflicted with Laduguer's Bite, a terrible illness.

HagBegsForMercy.synopsis: The hag is on the brink of defeated. She's stoppped the fight to try and plead for her life by offering the player the thing she does best - a deal. If Mayrina is present she asks offers you a powerful gift in exchange for her life (she will also take Mayrina with her) or the hag can bargain for Mayrina's life but lose out on the powerful gift. It is a tense and heightened situation.
HagBegsForMercy.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -49 281; pass the check (Shift+Q) and have the illusion of the Sunlit Wetlands come off and reveal the Putrid Bog.4. goto -45, 6, 267; go into the Teahouse and confront the Hag; let her leave with Mayrina.5. Recon infiniteAp and god6.  goto -386.96, -5.56, 562.11; walk towards Mayrina; combat will start.7. Attack the Hag until she has around 10 HP; end your turn.8. Scene should start, where the Hag begs for her life.

PAD_Explore2.synopsis: Players are wandering around the Hag Lair and have gotten into her workshop. It is filled with blood and bones. The hag may or may not be alive at this point.

VB_EnteredGallery.synopsis: Triggers as you enter the hag gallery. It's creepy.

Victim_003.synopsis:
This victim was cursed to see the future by the hag. In his initial dialogue, he is SEVERELY traumatised - sitting down, knees up, peeking out between his arms. He should sound quite disturbed, as if his sanity has long since deserted him.

He doesn't look at the player until halfway through the dialogue. When he looks up, he believes the player to be a monster of nightmares - a mindflayer. This is a terrifying moment for the player, as they are fighting a parasite in their head that will cause them to turn into a mindflayer.

In his dialogue in which he's met the player but has survived the hag, his gift is gone - but once he realises the player is the monster he saw before, he runs - terrified. 

In his post hag dialogue he is saddened and clearly traumatised by his time with the hag - and the thought of the life he could have led.

AD_HagAttacksCage.synopsis: These are fired during the fight with the hag. The first occurs when Mayrina's cage is set on fire, the second if she dies.

AD_HagCackles_0.context: NodeContext: A set of different cackles for Ethel. All evil. All nasty. All mean. At least three different kinds.

PAD_Explore1_2.speaker: Player
PAD_Explore1_2.text: That smell - something died in here.

AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor_0.text: 'A thief who tried to steal from Auntie. Now the good little pet guards my home.'

AD_VictimSign_004_0.text: 'My sweet Calim, whose beloved asked that his beauty never fade.'

PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral_0.speaker: Player
PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral_0.text: They're not attacking. Must think I'm one of them.

PAD_AtEntrance_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AtEntrance_0.context: NodeContext: Wyll's line: a bit sing-songy but not too much.

Victim_001_17.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_17.text: Ungh... what... argh... what in the bloody hells is going on?
Victim_001_17.context: NodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.

Victim_001_75.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_75.text: Help? You bloody Duergar gave me the Bite! But... the way I feel...
Victim_001_75.context: NodeContext: Player has said they're here to help. You're relived and still putting the piece together. Grateful and happy.

Victim_001_64.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_64.text: How did you cure it? The Bite?
Victim_001_64.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and you can't believe they player managed to fix it (spoiler: they didn't)

Victim_001_99.speaker: Player
Victim_001_99.text: Laduguer's Bite? How'd you catch it?

Victim_001_51.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_51.text: The duergar, of course. Filthy greylings.
Victim_001_51.context: NodeContext: Spitting the word. These are your enemies and you were dying because of them.

Victim_001_63.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_63.text: I was on death's door when the hag cast... wait. You didn't - you didn't cure the Bite?
Victim_001_63.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. Turn the accusations on the player.

Victim_001_131.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_131.text: Gods, r-really? I thought I was dead. I was sure...  thank you. Thank you so much.
Victim_001_131.context: NodeContext: Player has said they're here to help. You're relived and still putting the piece together. Grateful and happy.

Victim_001_52.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_52.text: You did what? But - but you can't!
Victim_001_52.context: NodeContext: Player has removed a spell that prevented you from dying. Panic and rage as you try to explain.

Victim_001_104.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_104.text: I've the bloody Bite! Laduguer's Bite! The petrification stopped it spreading...
Victim_001_104.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implications.

Victim_001_132.speaker: Player
Victim_001_132.text: You should be grateful. I expect payment.

Victim_001_58.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_58.text: Grateful? I've got Laduguer's Bite! I'm dying! Why else do you think I was petrified?
Victim_001_58.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implications.

Victim_001_9.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_9.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. You're about to die and you know it.

Victim_001_81.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_81.text: I - I remember that bit. I think. She...  turned me to stone. Because of the Bite! Of course.
Victim_001_81.context: NodeContext: Your memories are coming back. You remember going to the hag for a spell to save you.

Victim_001_124.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_124.text: I can't believe you fixed it. How did you cure me?
Victim_001_124.context: NodeContext: . You have an incurable disease and you can't believe they player managed to fix it (spoiler: they didn't)

Victim_001_149.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_149.text: Laduguer's  Bite? I caught it when - wait. You didn't... you didn't fix it?
Victim_001_149.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implications.

Victim_001_86.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_86.text: Why would you turn me back if you didn't -
Victim_001_86.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. Turn the accusations on the player.

Victim_001_144.speaker: Player
Victim_001_144.text: I fixed your petrification - nothing else.

Victim_001_130.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_130.text: Well - yes. Why d'ya bloody think I'm here?
Victim_001_130.context: NodeContext: Player has asked about your disease and was it contagious. You're surprised and confused by the question.

Victim_001_83.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_83.text: Oh, no, no. Why - why did you remove the spell if ya couldn't fix me?!
Victim_001_83.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. You realise the player hasn't cured you of a horrible and contagious disease you have - they've condemned you to death.

Victim_001_121.speaker: Player
Victim_001_121.text: What kind of fool would make a pact with a hag?

Victim_001_125.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_125.text: I had no bloody choice! I'm dying!
Victim_001_125.context: NodeContext: The player has been condescending to you. You went to a hag to save your life. Angry and embarassed.

Victim_001_48.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_48.text: She petrified me to stop it from spreading until - oh no.
Victim_001_48.context: NodeContext: You realise the player didn't cure you. They've condemned you to death. Panic rising. Frightened.

Victim_001_115.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Choking a little - gripping his stomach. Reaching forward with one hand - as if to grab the player. NodeContext: Chokes a little - as if about to vomit. You're dying. Panic and fear ramped up to the max.

Victim_001_76.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_76.text: I don't want to die, I - *retch*
Victim_001_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic - clutches stomach as he vomits. He collapses on the ground - dead. in a pool of his own blood and vomit. NodeContext: Crying, freaking out, leaning over and vomiting horribly as they collapse on the ground.

Victim_001_40.speaker: Player
Victim_001_40.text: I've heard tales of Laduguer's Bite. Don't your insides end up on your outside?

Victim_001_37.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_37.text: The very one. Complete with everything from sores to vomitin' blood. By the time it kills you it - wait.
Victim_001_37.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implication - the player hasn't cured you.

Victim_001_94.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_94.text: You didn't fix it? Oh no.
Victim_001_94.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. Turn the accusations on the player as they realise they haven't

Victim_001_53.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom Cam - Tilt Up + RotationNodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.

Victim_001_84.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_84.text: Oh no. No. Why ain't I petrified?
Victim_001_84.context: NodeContext: Panic as you realise the petrification - the thing keeping a deadly disease from spreading across your body - is gone.

Victim_001_69.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_69.text: What?! How... how am I still breathin'?
Victim_001_69.context: NodeContext: Player has said the hag is dead - which means so should you. You're shocked.

Victim_001_118.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_118.context: NodeContext: Confused as you look down at your hands and body - feeling fine. You're trying to make sense of everything.

Victim_001_30.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_30.text: I wouldn't wish it on anyone. Yer insides... end up on the outside. Petrification stops the spread.
Victim_001_30.context: NodeContext: Wincing as you described the horrific disease. Think the Black Plague.

Victim_001_141.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_141.text: I was on death's door. But now I feel... I feel great.
Victim_001_141.context: NodeContext: You're grateful tp be alive but also completely confused.

Victim_001_122.speaker: Player
Victim_001_122.text: Search for any sign of Laduguer's Bite.

Victim_001_35.speaker: Player
Victim_001_35.text: Look for remnants of the hag's magic.

Victim_001_88.speaker: Narrator
Victim_001_88.text: *You can't detect anything. You have no explanation for his good health.*

Victim_001_106.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_106.text: I s'pose I should count my blessings. Most ain't so lucky.
Victim_001_106.context: NodeContext: Player can't figure out why you're fine now. You don't want to look at it too closely. Grateful to be alive.

Victim_001_32.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_32.text: Look, greyling or not, you having a look put my mind at ease.

Victim_001_109.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_109.text: Not enough to hang around here, mind, but... thank you. And best of luck.

Victim_001_135.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_135.text: I don't fancy hangin' around here. But... thank you. And best of luck.
Victim_001_135.context: NodeContext: Gratitude - you are only alive because of the player.

Victim_001_148.speaker: Player
Victim_001_148.text: Examine him for signs of Laduguer's Bite.

Victim_001_0.speaker: Player
Victim_001_0.text: Examine him for signs of Laduguer's Bite.

Victim_001_116.speaker: Narrator
Victim_001_116.text: *Not only is the disease gone, you see it's left no scars - an impossibility for the Bite.*

Victim_001_103.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_103.text: What? But that doesn't make a lick of sense. Unless...
Victim_001_103.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

Victim_001_28.speaker: Narrator
Victim_001_28.text: *As far as you can tell, he's in perfectly good health.*

Victim_001_67.speaker: Player
Victim_001_67.text: In the tales, hags always cook up their victim's misery first, then sell them false hope.

Victim_001_25.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_25.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

Victim_001_13.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_13.context: NodeContext: Spitting the words - you're furious.

Victim_001_44.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_44.text: She made me sick.  And then trapped me in stone for kicks.
Victim_001_44.context: NodeContext: This is shocking realisation - you nearly died because you trusted the hag.

Victim_001_65.speaker: Player
Victim_001_65.text: I'm sorry this happened to you.

Victim_001_119.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_119.text: I left me wife, me kids behind, for fear of infecting them. They were only babes.
Victim_001_119.context: NodeContext: The reality of your situation is dawning on you - you may have missed out on the entirety of your children's lives - for nothing.

Victim_001_100.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_100.text: The stones know how old they are now.

Victim_001_15.speaker: Player
Victim_001_15.text: How long were you trapped like this?

Victim_001_59.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_59.text: I - I don't know. Days? Years?
Victim_001_59.context: NodeContext: The reality of your situation is dawning on you - you may have missed out on the entirety of your children's lives - for nothing.

Victim_001_14.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_14.text: My kids were only babes when I left. The stones know how old they are now.

Victim_001_123.speaker: Player
Victim_001_123.text: Focus on the positive. At least now you'll see them again.

Victim_001_133.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_133.context: NodeContext: Usually a gruff man, it is difficult for you to truly express how thankful and grateful you are - but you're trying.

Victim_001_136.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_136.text: I... I ain't got no way to repay you.

Victim_001_105.speaker: Player
Victim_001_105.text: Hopefully they've grown. Children are disgusting.

Victim_001_87.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_87.text: Heh. I thought the same, 'til I held me own in my arms.
Victim_001_87.context: NodeContext: Player has said children are gross. A knowing smile as you think of your own. Love in your voice.

Victim_001_129.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_129.text: I'll get to see them again, hold 'em again, 'cause of you. I - I ain't got not way to repay you.
Victim_001_129.context: NodeContext: Usually a gruff man, it is difficult for you to truly express how thankful and grateful you are - but you're trying.

Victim_001_41.speaker: Player
Victim_001_41.text: Listen, I have places to be.

Victim_001_8.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_8.text: Sorry - now ain't the time for blathering.
Victim_001_8.context: NodeContext: Trying to pull yourself together after getting emotional - unusual for you.

Victim_001_43.speaker: Player
Victim_001_43.text: But now you have many more years ahead of you.

Victim_001_22.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_22.text: True. And I don't plan to waste a moment more.
Victim_001_22.context: NodeContext: Determined - you're gonna find your kids and fast.

Victim_001_146.speaker: Player
Victim_001_146.text: Why would you wish to meet your spawn?

Victim_001_140.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_140.context: NodeContext: Surprised at the player's reaction - you wonder if they've ever had a family to call their own.

Victim_001_114.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_114.text: Tell you what, you ever come by my way? You've a seat at my dinner table.
Victim_001_114.context: NodeContext: Friendly and warm. You feel for the player.

Victim_001_113.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_113.text: I... only wish I could do more to repay you.
Victim_001_113.context: NodeContext: Usually a gruff man, it is difficult for you to truly express how thankful and grateful you are - but you're trying.

Victim_001_80.speaker: Player
Victim_001_80.text: Don't worry. I didn't help just to get a reward.

Victim_001_139.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_139.text: No - what you've done for me and mine today won't be forgotten.
Victim_001_139.context: NodeContext: Stern but kind - you're determined to pay the player back -one day

Victim_001_23.speaker: Player
Victim_001_23.text: Damn it. You could've said as much from the start.

Victim_001_19.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_19.text: I'll find another way. I swear to you.
Victim_001_19.context: NodeContext: Stern but kind - you're determined to pay the player back -one day

Victim_001_134.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_134.context: NodeContext: Voice thick with emotion as you think of your family - and that you'll see them again soon.

Victim_001_1.speaker: Player
Victim_001_1.text: Oh, you'll figure it out. You owe me a debt, and I intend to collect.

Victim_001_20.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_20.text: You won't be left wanting. You've my word.
Victim_001_20.context: NodeContext: Stern but kind - you're determined to pay the player back -one day

Victim_001_45.speaker: Player
Victim_001_45.text: I'm almost impressed - that's evil, even by a hag's standards.

Victim_001_96.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_96.text: Evil don't begin to cover it.

Victim_001_73.speaker: Player
Victim_001_73.text: Attune with your blood and search him for magic.

Victim_001_91.speaker: Player
Victim_001_91.text: I can feel the hag's magic on you - it tastes of sickness.

Victim_001_97.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_97.text: What? Are you sayin' it wasn't the Bite? But... bloody hells.
Victim_001_97.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

Victim_001_68.speaker: Player
Victim_001_68.text: Mordenkainen warns us that hags often cause their victims' tragedies.

Victim_001_56.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_56.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

Victim_001_21.speaker: Player
Victim_001_21.text: Examine him for signs of magic.

Victim_001_107.speaker: Narrator
Victim_001_107.text: *You detect traces of decaying magic within him. Likely the cause of his disease.*

Victim_001_150.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_150.text: But that doesn't make a lick of sense. The Bite ain't magical. Unless...
Victim_001_150.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

Victim_001_70.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_70.context: NodeContext: Spitting the words - you're furious.

Victim_001_36.speaker: Player
Victim_001_36.text: No time for questions. Get out of here while you still can.

Victim_001_85.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_85.text: Yer right. And look... thank you. I don't know how you pulled it off - but thank you.
Victim_001_85.context: NodeContext: Gratitude - you are only alive because of the player.

Victim_001_108.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_108.text: Why d'ya think I'm here? The hag petrified me. Only way to stop it.
Victim_001_108.context: NodeContext: Said sadly - it was a difficult choice and one you struggled with.

Victim_001_12.speaker: Player
Victim_001_12.text: You struck a deal with the hag, didn't you?

Victim_001_142.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_142.text: I had to. I was sick. Real sick. The hag petrified me - to stop it spreading.
Victim_001_142.context: NodeContext: Said sadly - it was a difficult choice and one you struggled with.

Victim_001_54.speaker: Player
Victim_001_54.text: The Bite's a terrible disease. I can see why you went to the hag.

Victim_001_102.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_102.text: Right? It was that or die covered in me own insides. It's why she petrified me - to stop the spread.
Victim_001_102.context: NodeContext: You're speaking to someone who knows of the disease.

Victim_001_90.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_90.text: Why d'ya think I came to the hag? It was get petrified... or end up covered in me own insides.
Victim_001_90.context: NodeContext: Said sadly - it was a difficult choice and one you struggled with. You're speaking to someone who knows of the disease.

Victim_001_27.speaker: Player
Victim_001_27.text: Ha! The Bite should have turned you inside out by now.

Victim_001_145.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_145.text: Better dead than a greyling. Why d'ya think we call it Laduguer's Bite? After that slaver of a god you adore?

Victim_001_95.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_95.text: Because nothing disgusts us more than you lot.

Victim_001_7.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_7.text: Argh. The stones take you, you disgusting half-breed. I'll deal with this myself.

Victim_001_112.speaker: Player
Victim_001_112.text: We 'greylings' know the Bite well - ask nicely, and I'll see how long you've got left.

Victim_001_128.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_128.text: I... could you have a look?

Victim_001_72.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_72.text: Could you have a look... please.

Victim_001_147.speaker: Player
Victim_001_147.text: Changed my mind. Enjoy tripping over your own guts.

Victim_001_49.speaker: Player
Victim_001_49.text: Because I saved you. You're welcome.

Victim_001_120.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_120.text: But - but how? The hag said there was no cure.
Victim_001_120.context: NodeContext: You should be dead. You have an incurable disease. You're trying to make sense of everything.

Victim_001_34.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_34.text: And that the Bite... Laduguer's Bite was fatal.
Victim_001_34.context: NodeContext: Confused as you look down at your hands and body - feeling fine.

Victim_001_62.speaker: Player
Victim_001_62.text: You don't sound pleased. Would you rather be a statue?

Victim_001_57.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_57.text: I - I have the Bite. Laduguer's Bite.
Victim_001_57.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease - admitting it with worry and shame.

Victim_001_11.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_11.text: How... how am I still breathin'?
Victim_001_11.context: NodeContext: Confused as you look down at your hands and body - feeling fine. You're trying to make sense of everything.

Victim_001_60.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_60.text: I'm getting out of this hellhole. You'd best do the same.
Victim_001_60.context: NodeContext: You're alive but that could change at any moment. Nearly running out the door.

Victim_001_66.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom Cam - Tilt Up + RotationNodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.

AD_VictimSign_005_0.text: 'This poor dear wished never to lay eyes on her family again.'

VB_BurningCage_0.speaker: Player
VB_BurningCage_0.context: NodeContext: You're trying to save a woman. She's trapped in a cage that is one fire.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2_0.text: Hah! Catch me if you can, petal!
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2_0.context: NodeContext: You've turned invisible and disappeared during the fight. Laughing and joking with amused menace.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2_1.text: Try to find me now, brat!
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2_1.context: NodeContext: You've turned invisible and disappeared during the fight. Pissed off and raging at the player.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2_2.context: NodeContext: You've turned invisible and disappeared during the fight. Sing song and mocking tone.

TalkingDoor_3.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_3.text: *You feel the barest hint of life from within the door.*

TalkingDoor_11.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_11.text: *You feel crushing waves of fear as the presence within the door recoils. It can't let people through. Not again!*
TalkingDoor_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just a shot of the player and the door - no visions yet. Player pressing a hand to their head as waves of fear hit them.

TalkingDoor_14.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_14.text: *You feel a touch of the hag's magic, but whatever this door once held is gone.*
TalkingDoor_14.context: InternalNodeContext: The hag is dead, and the player never knew that it was alive in the past.

TalkingDoor_27.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_27.text: *The presence within cowers - terrified of you.*

TalkingDoor_39.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_39.text: *The presence within sobs. The hag is gone. He's trapped in this door, this wooden prison - forever.*
TalkingDoor_39.context: InternalNodeContext: The hag is dead, and the player saw that it was alive in the past.

TalkingDoor_48.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_48.text: *You feel the barest touch of magic, wild and chaotic, beneath the twisted surface of the door.*
TalkingDoor_48.context: InternalNodeContext: The hag didn't flee to her lair.

TalkingDoor_54.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_54.text: *You feel crushing waves of fear as a presence within the door recoils. It can't let people through. Not again!*
TalkingDoor_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just a shot of the player and the door - no visions yet. Player pressing a hand to their head as waves of fear hit them.

TalkingDoor_53.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_53.text: What happened last time you opened?

TalkingDoor_9.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_9.text: *Images flash: a man cowering, a bag open at his feet. Gold coins spilling onto the floor.*
TalkingDoor_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cue cut scene: a shot of a man cowering, terrified on the ground. A bag of coins - open and spilled out on the ground.

TalkingDoor_4.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_4.text: *His cries for mercy are cut short as the hag slices into him, dismembering him painstakingly, limb by limb.*
TalkingDoor_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cut scene: He's crying - shaking his head - back away clearly terrified. Shot of the hag - talons out appraoching him . Silohuette shot of her diving her claws down - ripping sounds.

TalkingDoor_44.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_44.text: *She cackles. The man's remaining flesh twisted and contorted...*
TalkingDoor_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot - hag laughing as she raising her hands - vines erupt from the man's body - twisting upwards

TalkingDoor_52.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_52.text: *...becoming the twisted surface of the door before you.*

TalkingDoor_31.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_31.text: *You see the gallery, its walls lined with the hag's victims - their bodies and minds twisted beyond ruin.*
TalkingDoor_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the gallery - the huddled victim in the mirror, the headless victim, the vacant bleeding eyes sockets

TalkingDoor_0.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_0.text: I'm not afraid of that hag.

TalkingDoor_35.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_35.text: *A scene appears in your mind: two paladins and a cleric marching through the door - shrouded in the glow of the divine.*
TalkingDoor_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cut scene - two paladins and a cleric walking in the area after the door, cleric hands at the ready to cast a spelll, one paladin with a two handed sword out, the other with a shield and mace - moving forward

TalkingDoor_22.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_22.text: *Weapons brandished, they charge into the hag's lair.*
TalkingDoor_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The charge forward - deeper into the lair

TalkingDoor_66.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Screams, sounds of flesh tearing and the hag laughing

TalkingDoor_38.text: You let them in? Naughty. That's a decade for each. You're mine for thirty more years, petal.
TalkingDoor_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of hag's feet as she walks towards the door, camera on her face covered in blood as she smiles at the doorNodeContext: Full hag mode - you've just murdered three people in cold blood;. You approach the person who let them in, taunting them and being cruel.

TalkingDoor_57.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_57.text: *They are left as scabs of life, while she spits on the beauty their death would sow.*

TalkingDoor_49.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_49.text: I mean it. Let me through.

TalkingDoor_5.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_5.text: *Its form flickers, and you realise that the door is transparent.*
TalkingDoor_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The coloured sheen from the masks (when you wear them) passes over the doors

TalkingDoor_51.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_51.text: I can see through you. I can just walk right in.

TalkingDoor_2.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_2.text: *You see the hag, eyes bright with glee, as she sets fire to the door.*
TalkingDoor_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the hag, laughing as she throws back her head, the door engulfed in flames

TalkingDoor_24.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_24.text: *With a jerk, you're pulled from the vision. The presence within shrinks - begging you not to run through it.*
TalkingDoor_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player - touching their head in confusion

TalkingDoor_58.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_58.text: Open up, or I'll burn you to ashes.

TalkingDoor_46.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_46.text: *The door shudders, imagining its wooden frame cracking and splintering in a raging inferno.*
TalkingDoor_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the door burning in fire - you hear a man's scream

TalkingDoor_30.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_30.text: *You see the hag. She walks through the door, its form shimmering.*
TalkingDoor_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of door shimmering in coloured sheen (like mask effect) and hag walking through it

TalkingDoor_32.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_32.text: *With a jerk, you're pulled from the vision. You feel the presence within shrink - terrified.*

TalkingDoor_62.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_62.text: *The door remains firmly closed as the presence shrinks, twisting with fear and despair.*

TalkingDoor_34.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_34.text: If I kill the hag, you'll be free.

TalkingDoor_26.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_26.text: *You see the hag. She walks through the door - its form shimmering.*
TalkingDoor_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of door shimmering in coloured sheen (like mask effect) and hag walking through it

TalkingDoor_28.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_28.text: *The lightest touch of hope brushes your mind as the presence within retreats.*

TalkingDoor_42.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_42.text: *Fear rushes through you as the door shakes, remembering the hag's smile.*
TalkingDoor_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of door - maybe a rattling sound?

TalkingDoor_12.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_12.text: *It remains firmly closed as the presence huddles within.*
TalkingDoor_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player glaring at door

TalkingDoor_33.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_33.text: I will strike the hag down with the full force of my fury - I swear it.

TalkingDoor_7.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_7.text: If you let me through, I will do all I can to free you from your torment - I swear it.

TalkingDoor_74.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_74.text: The hag is perversion of nature, and I am sworn to strike her down - you have nothing to fear from me.

TalkingDoor_8.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_8.text: All right, is there another way in?

TalkingDoor_18.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_18.text: *You see an image of blue skies and sunshine as the door shudders a warning - run.*
TalkingDoor_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of blue sky - sunshine. A happy forest scene.

TalkingDoor_72.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_72.text: The hag will be the least of your problems if you don't open up.

TalkingDoor_45.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_45.text: I have to get through. Now.

TalkingDoor_20.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_20.text: *Frustrated, the door rattles. You see the hag and... yourself?*
TalkingDoor_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot as if through the player's eyes. Perspective from the ground looking up - seeing the hag looking down at you - smiling

TalkingDoor_29.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_29.text: *You lay bleeding as she leans over you - a smile on her face.*

TalkingDoor_36.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_36.text: *Her teeth, a row of deadly needles, shine as they dive into your throat, blood spraying.*
TalkingDoor_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Her mouth opens as she laughs and she dives towards you - shot of blood spraying into the air/onto the ground

TalkingDoor_59.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_59.text: Not happening. The hag will die first - count on it.

TalkingDoor_47.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_47.text: Are you going to open up or not?

TalkingDoor_21.speaker: Player
TalkingDoor_21.text: No time to chat. I'm here to kill the hag.

TalkingDoor_71.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_71.text: *The door trembles at the thought of the hag. She would be furious if she caught intruders here.*

TalkingDoor_75.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor_75.text: *You feel a whisper of thanks as the door's prisoner fades away.*
TalkingDoor_75.context: InternalNodeContext: The hag is dead, and the player saw that it was alive in the past.

AD_VictimSign_002_0.text: 'My darling Magron. She wished for the mind of a genius, but the silly head crossed me.'

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real_0.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real_0.text: Get me out of this hellhole!
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real_0.context: NodeContext: The hag has sent out illusions that look like you. You're horrified and crying out to the player, running towards them for safety. It's in the middle of a fight and you're scared but still being your usual bratty and petulant self.

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real_1.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real_1.context: NodeContext: The hag has sent out illusions that look like you. You're horrified and crying out to the player, running towards them for safety. It's in the middle of a fight and you're scared but still being your usual bratty and petulant self.

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real_2.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real_2.context: NodeContext: Breatheless, relieved. Ran across the battlefield to get to the player.

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real_3.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real_3.context: NodeContext: The hag has sent out illusions that look like you. You're horrified and crying out to the player, running towards them for safety. It's in the middle of a fight and you're scared but still being your usual bratty and petulant self.

Victim_003_Dead_13.speaker: Narrator
Victim_003_Dead_13.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Victim_003_Dead_17.speaker: Narrator
Victim_003_Dead_17.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Victim_003_Dead_1.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead_1.text: ... I could see... a person's fate... horrible.

Victim_003_Dead_19.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead_19.text: ... but... no more. I am Lorin... only...

Victim_003_Dead_8.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Dead_8.text: How did you end up in the cave?

Victim_003_Dead_14.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead_14.text: Trapped... between two choices... I made a deal... to see my fate...

Victim_003_Dead_0.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead_0.text: ... but all I saw... was death... so I ran... ran here...

Victim_003_Dead_11.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Dead_11.text: What can you tell me about the hag?

Victim_003_Dead_4.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead_4.text: ... she gives you... exactly what... was promised...

Victim_003_Dead_7.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Dead_7.text: Do you regret making a deal with the hag?

Victim_003_Dead_15.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead_15.text: Making a... deal? Yes. Being... here...? No.

Victim_003_Dead_12.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead_12.text: Here... I couldn't see it... couldn't see... my family... dead and rotten.

Victim_003_Dead_18.speaker: Narrator
Victim_003_Dead_18.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake_0.context: NodeContext: This is the fake illusion. She has Mayrina's voice and is pretending to be Mayrina. Crying in the fight - begging and pleading for the player to believe that they are the real Mayrina and the other is the fake. It should ring a little false.

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake_1.text: Don't let that awful hag hurt me!
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake_1.context: NodeContext: This is the fake illusion. She has Mayrina's voice and is pretending to be Mayrina. Crying in the fight - begging and pleading for the player to believe that they are the real Mayrina and the other is the fake. It should ring a little false.

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake_2.context: NodeContext: This is the fake illusion. She has Mayrina's voice and is pretending to be Mayrina. Crying in the fight - begging and pleading for the player to believe that they are the real Mayrina and the other is the fake. It should ring a little false.

AD_SummonVictims_0.context: NodeContext: You're forcing two people to come help you in battle - it's a spell and they have no free will. Soft alluring voice as you call our to them across the room.

Victim_005_Dead_8.speaker: Narrator
Victim_005_Dead_8.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Victim_005_Dead_11.speaker: Player
Victim_005_Dead_11.text: Why did you go to the hag?

Victim_005_Dead_3.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead_3.text: My family took her... my baby girl...

Victim_005_Dead_9.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead_9.text: Told Ethel... never wanted... to see them again... she... took my eyes...

Victim_005_Dead_5.speaker: Player
Victim_005_Dead_5.text: Why did your family take your child?

Victim_005_Dead_2.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead_2.text: They didn't like... me having something... they couldn't touch.

Victim_005_Dead_16.speaker: Player
Victim_005_Dead_16.text: What can you tell me about Ethel?

Victim_005_Dead_6.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead_6.text: Doesn't matter... nothing matters... without... baby girl...

Victim_005_Dead_1.speaker: Player
Victim_005_Dead_1.text: Is there anything I should know about this place?

Victim_005_Dead_0.speaker: Narrator
Victim_005_Dead_0.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

VB_MayrinaInCage_0.speaker: Player
VB_MayrinaInCage_0.context: NodeContext: You've spotted the woman you're trying to save.

Victim_003_Freed_47.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_47.text: Is the hag gone? Gods, tell me she's gone. Oh, please.
Victim_003_Freed_47.context: NodeContext: You're lucid and coherent but terrified - looking around you for the hag.

Victim_003_Freed_49.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_49.text: The things she did - the things she made me do.
Victim_003_Freed_49.context: NodeContext: Almost not speaking to the player. You mind is flashing back to the den of horrors that was the hag's lair, and the torments you suffered at her hands.

Victim_003_Freed_5.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_5.context: NodeContext: Absolute horror as you recognise the player as the monster you saw before. Lean back eyes wide and terrified.

Victim_003_Freed_4.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_4.text: You - you're the one. The mind flayer.

Victim_003_Freed_44.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed_44.text: Not if I can help it. Can you still see it?

Victim_003_Freed_29.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_29.text: No - the hag's 'gift' is gone but it's - it's going to happen. Soon.
Victim_003_Freed_29.context: NodeContext: You're describing your vision. You flee at the end of this scene. Horror mounting as you recall the player - butchering everyone in their path

Victim_003_Freed_20.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_20.text: I saw you screaming - covered in your own insides as that - that thing bursts out of your skull.
Victim_003_Freed_20.context: NodeContext: You sound traumatised here as you mind flashes back to the player, skin peeling, vomiting their insides as they transform into a murderous killing machine.

Victim_003_Freed_13.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_13.text: You change, skin ripping from your body and then you butcher... everyone. Everyone around you.
Victim_003_Freed_13.context: NodeContext: This is a big moment - you've just confirmed the player's worst fears. You sound utterly horrified, almost dazed, as you finish describing the scene.

Victim_003_Freed_21.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed_21.text: Be specific. When will this happen?

Victim_003_Freed_27.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_27.text: I - I don't know. It could be a tenday.

Victim_003_Freed_1.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_1.text: I can't do this. You're too dangerous. I'm - I'm sorry.

Victim_003_Freed_63.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed_63.text: Why should I trust you? Or the hag's magic?

Victim_003_Freed_7.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_7.text: Hag magic it might be, but it's never been wrong. Not once.

Victim_003_Freed_15.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_15.text: I can't stay. You're too dangerous. But I hope... I only hope it's a quick death.

Victim_003_Freed_41.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed_41.text: I butcher everyone? That sounds delightful.

Victim_003_Freed_37.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_37.text: Death can't come quick enough for you - monster.

Victim_003_Freed_39.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed_39.text: I have no idea what you're talking about.

Victim_003_Freed_28.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_28.text: No. I saw it. You're covered in blood and gore - vomiting. And then... your skull splits open.
Victim_003_Freed_28.context: NodeContext: You're describing your vision. You flee at the end of this scene. Horror mounting as you recall the player - butchering everyone in their path.

Victim_003_Freed_52.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_52.text: That thing bursts out of you and you're - you're screaming.
Victim_003_Freed_52.context: NodeContext: You sound traumatised here as you mind flashes back to the player, skin peeling, vomiting their insides as they transform into a murderous killing machine.

Victim_003_Freed_12.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_12.text: I still hear it. Still see your eyes go dead, and you... you butcher them. Everyone around you.
Victim_003_Freed_12.context: NodeContext: This is a big moment - you've just confirmed the player's worst fears. You sound utterly horrified, almost dazed, as you finish describing the scene.

Victim_003_Freed_16.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed_16.text: I saved your life. Be grateful.

Victim_003_Freed_0.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_0.text: No. You don't understand. You kill them.
Victim_003_Freed_0.context: NodeContext: You're describing your vision. Pleading as you struggle to explain the player's future to them. Horror mounting.

Victim_003_Freed_55.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed_55.text: Say that again, and I'll rip your throat out with my teeth.

Victim_003_Freed_35.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed_35.text: Shut your damn mouth. And never call me that again.

Victim_003_Freed_45.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed_45.text: You're lucky to be alive. I could have killed you.

Victim_003_Freed_62.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_62.text: That damn shrew would have loved it. Would have loved watching you murder me.
Victim_003_Freed_62.context: NodeContext: Player has said you're lucky to be alive. You attacked the player against your will but they knocked you out -saving your life. You're still horrified - the hag probably planned for you to die that way.

Victim_003_Freed_34.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_34.text: No. Not even a little bit.
Victim_003_Freed_34.context: NodeContext: The player has asked if you're all right. You look away, ashamed and broken.

Victim_003_Freed_18.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_18.text: The hag - there's never been a more vile creature.
Victim_003_Freed_18.context: NodeContext: Almost not speaking to the player. You mind is flashing back to the den of horrors that was the hag's lair, and the torments you suffered at her hands.

Victim_003_Freed_32.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_32.text: The things she did to me - the things she made me do I...

Victim_003_Freed_14.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_14.text: May she burn in the Nine Hells.
Victim_003_Freed_14.context: NodeContext: Hatred and fear in your voice as you think of the hag.

Victim_003_Freed_26.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_26.text: The hag - there's never been a more vile creature. The things she did to me...

Victim_003_Freed_23.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_23.text: I was a fool. I wanted to know my fate. I had a choice between two lives, and I was frightened of choosing wrong.
Victim_003_Freed_23.context: NodeContext: Player has asked how you ended up in the hag lair. Your voice is filled with regret.

Victim_003_Freed_46.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_46.text: I asked the hag to help me see what the future would hold. Got what I wished for, too.

Victim_003_Freed_3.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_3.text: I saw my future self - a corpse, rotten with maggots. And everyone around me dead. Putrid and dead.
Victim_003_Freed_3.context: NodeContext: Dazed horror as you recall the visions that pushed you to the brink of insanity.

Victim_003_Freed_36.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed_36.text: You mentioned choosing between two lives. What were they?

Victim_003_Freed_6.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_6.text: A boring story. Stay or go. Marriage and kids or a life of novelty.
Victim_003_Freed_6.context: NodeContext: Your voice is filled with regret. You gave up everything because you were too afarid to make a choice.

Victim_003_Freed_2.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_2.text: I lost my best years rather than just... choose.

Victim_003_Freed_58.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed_58.text: Leave while you can - and be careful.

Victim_003_Freed_48.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed_48.text: Leave darthiir - before I finished what the hag started.

Victim_003_Freed_50.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed_50.context: NodeContext: Hurried and subservient as you duck your head, making to leave

AD_VictimSign_003_0.text: 'My gentle Lorin. He wished to know what was to come.'

Victim_004_0.speaker: Narrator
Victim_004_0.text: *The mirror glints in the light - the screams from within now silent.*

Victim_004_1.speaker: Narrator
Victim_004_1.text: *As you edge closer to the mirror, a pale face appears, contorted in fear. Fists slam against the mirror's surface. Again and again.*
Victim_004_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Screams growing louderInternalNodeContext: Screams growing louder

Victim_004_2.speaker: Narrator
Victim_004_2.text: *You see the shadowed outline of a figure.*

VB_MirrorScreams_0.speaker: Player
VB_MirrorScreams_0.context: NodeContext: Confused at the sound but you can't tell where it is.

VB_MirrorScreams_1.speaker: Player
VB_MirrorScreams_1.text: Those screams - someone's trapped in that mirror.

ControlledByMask_26.speaker: Narrator
ControlledByMask_26.text: *The stench of rot is a slap to the face. Suddenly she is there. Beside you. Behind you. Inside you.*

ControlledByMask_25.speaker: Lae'zel
ControlledByMask_25.text: Yes. I have you now, petal. Don't worry. Auntie is going to take good care of you.

ControlledByMask_17.speaker: Player
ControlledByMask_17.text: Focus on your oath as you try to wrest control from the hag.

ControlledByMask_29.text: ARGH! THAT HURT, YOU LITTLE SHIT!
ControlledByMask_29.context: NodeContext: in pain, howling (this is happening mental so no mocap needed)

ControlledByMask_7.text: Bah - I don't need the mask to crack that little mind of yours like an egg. See you soon, petal.
ControlledByMask_7.context: NodeContext: vicious and threatening (this is happening mental so no mocap needed)

ControlledByMask_22.text: Nice try, little paladin. Pity you lack conviction.
ControlledByMask_22.context: NodeContext: vicious and delighted - she's taken over the mind of the player (this is happening mental so no mocap needed)

ControlledByMask_36.speaker: Player
ControlledByMask_36.text: Focus on your oath as you try to wrest control from the hag.

ControlledByMask_3.speaker: Lae'zel
ControlledByMask_3.text: I'm in your head now, sweetie. And I'm not going anywhere.

ControlledByMask_32.speaker: Shadowheart
ControlledByMask_32.context: NodeContext: A little confused and unsettled - her companion suddenly isn't behaving like their nornal self.

ControlledByMask_35.speaker: Astarion
ControlledByMask_35.text: What's happening? What did you do?

ControlledByMask_9.speaker: Shadowheart
ControlledByMask_9.text: The mask. Take it off - right now!
ControlledByMask_9.context: NodeContext: She realises her companion is being possessed by the mask they're wearing.

ControlledByMask_15.speaker: Karlach
ControlledByMask_15.text: It's the mask! Get that thing off your face!

ControlledByMask_33.speaker: Astarion
ControlledByMask_33.text: It's the mask - take it off, you fool!

ControlledByMask_6.speaker: Wyll
ControlledByMask_6.text: It's the mask. Get that thing off!

ControlledByMask_13.speaker: Gale
ControlledByMask_13.text: It's that bloody mask. Take it off. Now!

ControlledByMask_20.speaker: Lae'zel
ControlledByMask_20.text: What are you...? Pa'vrylk - remove the mask. Now!
ControlledByMask_20.context: NodeContext: Pa'vrylk; Stop/cease. PAH-vrill-ck. Said with some panic.

ControlledByMask_12.speaker: Shadowheart
ControlledByMask_12.text: What are you playing at...? The mask - take it off!
ControlledByMask_12.context: NodeContext: Confusion turns to alarm as she realises her companion is being possessed by the mask they're wearing.

ControlledByMask_31.speaker: Karlach
ControlledByMask_31.text: The hag's in your head! Take that mask off - now!

ControlledByMask_37.speaker: Astarion
ControlledByMask_37.text: You fool. Take off the mask - now!

ControlledByMask_2.speaker: Wyll
ControlledByMask_2.text: Holy hells - get that thing off. Now!
ControlledByMask_2.context: NodeContext: Rising panic that ally is being mind controlled through a mask

ControlledByMask_8.speaker: Gale
ControlledByMask_8.text: Gods - what are you doing? Take off that mask, right bloody now!

ControlledByMask_30.text: Stay with me, petal. Stay with Auntie. Forever.

Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer_0.speaker: Player
Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer_0.text: A mind flayer. No intention of letting that happen.

Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer_1.speaker: Player
Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer_1.text: A mind flayer. No intention of letting that happen.

PutOnMask_1.text: Hello, petal. My, my - the mask suits you. Just relax. See the world with fresh eyes.

PutOnMask_0.text: And let your dear old Auntie Ethel look after you.

EntranceDouble_StatusFallback_2.text: You are as thick as they come, sweetness.
EntranceDouble_StatusFallback_2.context: NodeContext: Threatening smile while taunting player.The old lady act is gone.

EntranceDouble_StatusFallback_1.text: That pretty little eye of yours is mine. Did you think you could sneak down here without my say so?

EntranceDouble_StatusFallback_0.text: This is my personal play house. And you don't have an invite. Get. Out.
EntranceDouble_StatusFallback_0.context: NodeContext: The player is in a gallery full of your victims - horribly twisted and tortured. You're hinting that they will join them soon. Cruel and malicious.

AD_VictimSign_001_0.text: 'My dearest Efrin. He begged me to halt the deadly disease that ravaged him.'

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1_0.context: NodeContext: You've summoned illusions of yourself to confuse and taunt the player. You're calling out to them in a mocking and amused tone.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1_1.text: Am I here? Or am I there?
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1_1.context: NodeContext: You've summoned illusions of yourself to confuse and taunt the player. You're calling out to them in a mocking and amused tone.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1_2.context: NodeContext: You've summoned illusions of yourself to confuse and taunt the player. You're calling out to them in a mocking and amused tone.

AD_ViciousMockery_0.text: Think you're a person because you're walking on two feet? Adorable.

AD_ViciousMockery_1.text: Your people will never take you back - illithid scum.

AD_ViciousMockery_2.text: No flabby dwarf's a threat to me.

AD_ViciousMockery_4.text: Even the Underdark doesn't want you, half-breed.

AD_ViciousMockery_6.text: More beard than brains, the lot of you.

AD_ViciousMockery_7.text: Fancy yourself immortal? We'll see how long that lasts.

AD_ViciousMockery_8.text: I'll burn you alive and everyone will celebrate.
AD_ViciousMockery_8.context: NodeContext: Sadistically pleased with what she's saying.

AD_ViciousMockery_9.text: Come now, tusks-for-brains! Doesn't this make you angry?

AD_ViciousMockery_10.text: I can smell what's under those bandages, wizard. You're all rot and ruin.

AD_ViciousMockery_11.context: NodeContext: Disgusted, but aware of the irony (since she's a hag.)

AD_ViciousMockery_12.text: Bow your head, slave. You remember how, don't you?
AD_ViciousMockery_12.context: NodeContext: Coldly mocking. Pleased with herself.

AD_ViciousMockery_13.text: Let's pull your strings, infernal puppet.

AD_ViciousMockery_14.text: Come to greet death early? You'll be a lovely spectacle.

AD_ViciousMockery_15.text: Grey and useless as a stone comb.

AD_ViciousMockery_16.text: How quaint! The hamster has a pet.

AD_ViciousMockery_17.text: Aww, where's your clan? Bet they'd exile you for that brainworm in a blink.

AD_ViciousMockery_18.text: You're so far up Shar's cake you can't see straight. Pathetic.

AD_ViciousMockery_19.text: All that bloodlust. A little tap, and I bet you won't know friend from foe!

AD_ViciousMockery_20.text: A human! So desperate to be special.

AD_ViciousMockery_22.text: Pity. That tadpole actually made you interesting.
AD_ViciousMockery_22.context: NodeContext: Faking regret about having to the player (but not particularly well).

AD_ViciousMockery_23.text: Kneel, boy. Just like the matriarchs taught you to.
AD_ViciousMockery_23.context: NodeContext: Haughty and amused. Convinced of her superiority.

AD_ViciousMockery_24.text: You're everyone's punching bag and no one's favourite.

AD_ViciousMockery_25.text: What kind of botched portal brought something like you here?

AD_ViciousMockery_26.text: Do you think losing that eye made you a hero?

AD_ViciousMockery_27.text: Can't wait to throw a collar on your neck and make you my familiar.

AD_ViciousMockery_28.text: I'll show you what a true fey does, dearie.
AD_ViciousMockery_28.context: NodeContext: Hungry, pleased. Superior and ready to show her power.

AD_ViciousMockery_29.text: Who would be jealous of you, apprentice?

AD_ViciousMockery_32.text: Bet you'd trade your friends for a trinket or two, gold-eater!

AD_ViciousMockery_33.text: Elves are so pretty. Pretty worthless!
AD_ViciousMockery_33.context: NodeContext: Neutral tone initially, then laughing and mocking for 'pretty worthless!'

AD_ViciousMockery_34.text: Happy to sell everyone's soul but your own, aren't you?

AD_ViciousMockery_35.text: Do you miss kissing Vlaakith's feet, gith?

AD_ViciousMockery_36.text: Lumbering half-orc. Twice as ugly as your parents combined!

AD_ViciousMockery_37.text: I'll squeeze that stone heart until it bleeds, dwarf.
AD_ViciousMockery_37.context: NodeContext: Sadistically pleased with the threat.

AD_ViciousMockery_38.text: I wonder which parent regrets you more, half-breed.

AD_ViciousMockery_39.text: Come closer, little softie. You'll be tender.

AD_ViciousMockery_40.text: Why would Shar love you when no one else does?

AD_ViciousMockery_41.text: When I'm done, even the Hells won't want you.

AD_ViciousMockery_42.text: Bet that honour of yours shatters easy as your scales.

AD_ViciousMockery_43.context: NodeContext: Openly disgusted. Nearly spitting the words.

AD_ViciousMockery_44.text: Need a new master, illithid lover?

AD_ViciousMockery_45.text: Surprised you show yourself in public, abomination.

AD_ViciousMockery_46.text: Bet your clan's happy you're gone!

AD_ViciousMockery_47.text: Just another of Lolth's pretty harlots.

AD_ViciousMockery_48.text: I see the Hells spit out another tragic little tiefling.

AD_ViciousMockery_49.text: I'm one step closer to wiping your kind off Faerûn for good!

AD_ViciousMockery_50.text: Only evil here is what's inside you, ranger.

AD_ViciousMockery_53.text: You're one thirsty night away from betraying everyone.

AD_ViciousMockery_54.context: NodeContext: Open disgust. Dismissive of the player.

AD_ViciousMockery_55.text: Freakish thing. I bet everyone stares when you walk by.

AD_ViciousMockery_57.context: NodeContext: Mocking and amused at her own joke.

AD_ViciousMockery_58.text: Not a lot like you. You'll be my prettiest trophy.

AD_ViciousMockery_59.text: Slaver. Sadist. How dare you judge me?
AD_ViciousMockery_59.context: NodeContext: 'Slaver' and 'sadist' sharply punctuated. Deeply offended when asking the question.

AD_ViciousMockery_60.text: Are you lost, little one? Maybe your soul will make it back home.

AD_ViciousMockery_61.text: A toad with a tadpole! How fitting.

AD_ViciousMockery_62.text: You're no complex puzzle. Just a sad little girl.

AD_ViciousMockery_64.text: Deep down, you like being leashed, don't you?

AD_ViciousMockery_65.text: A tiny, sweet morsel. Just for me.
AD_ViciousMockery_65.context: NodeContext: Hungry and darkly pleased about it.

AD_ViciousMockery_66.text: I'll banish you for good, outsider!

AD_ViciousMockery_67.text: Try laughing after I rip your throat out, gnome.

AD_ViciousMockery_68.text: Is there still rat stuck in your teeth, slave?

AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion_2.speaker: Johl
AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion_2.text: I smell you from here, hag. That ain't Rina!
AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion_2.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of a fight. The hag has assumed the form of your sister but you can tell it's fake. Calling out a warning to the player - anger in your voice that the hag would try to trick you.

AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion_3.text: Hold on. I think it's Rina!

EntranceDouble_17.context: NodeContext: Threatening smile while taunting player.The old lady act is gone.

EntranceDouble_15.text: That pretty little eye of yours is mine. Did you think you could sneak down here without my say so?

EntranceDouble_0.text: This is my personal play house. And you don't have an invite. Get. Out.
EntranceDouble_0.context: NodeContext: The player is in a gallery full of your victims - horribly twisted and tortured. You're hinting that they will join them soon. Cruel and malicious.

EntranceDouble_3.text: Has that wriggler eaten your brain already? Leave. Or you'll end up in tonight's stew.
EntranceDouble_3.context: NodeContext: You're taunting the player with the truth - you're moments away from murdering the girl.

EntranceDouble_8.text: You'll go nicely with Mayrina. She's already marinating. HAH!
EntranceDouble_8.context: NodeContext: A laugh as you run off - evil and cruel sounding.

EntranceDouble_9.text: Oh, the cocky ones are my favourite to chew on.
EntranceDouble_9.context: NodeContext: vicious and delighted - can't wait to kill the player

EntranceDouble_2.text: Keep going, petal - and you'll find out. HAH.
EntranceDouble_2.context: NodeContext: A laugh as you vanish - vicious and cruel

EntranceDouble_19.speaker: Player
EntranceDouble_19.text: I think I'll stay a while.

EntranceDouble_20.speaker: Player
EntranceDouble_20.text: Forgive me. I'll leave right away.

EntranceDouble_7.text: You had better. Or I'll cut you into little pieces and serve you with a slice of lemon.

EntranceDouble_6.speaker: Player
EntranceDouble_6.text: I cannot. You are a perversion of the natural order, hag - I must kill you.

EntranceDouble_10.text: Gods alive, a paladin. You lot are drier than shite in the noonday sun.
EntranceDouble_10.context: NodeContext: Rolling her eyes - she hates paladins.

EntranceDouble_13.text: I've picked plenty of your brethren from my teeth, petal - and I look forward to seeing how tasty you are. HAH.

EntranceDouble_12.speaker: Player
EntranceDouble_12.text: I am sworn to end your life, hag - do not resist.

EntranceDouble_4.speaker: Player
EntranceDouble_4.text: I cannot - not without Mayrina. I won't let you hurt her.

EntranceDouble_1.text: She chose to be here, petal. But go ahead - risk yourself for the brat, and see where it gets you. HAH.
EntranceDouble_1.context: NodeContext: A laugh as you vanish - vicious and cruel

EntranceDouble_14.speaker: Player
EntranceDouble_14.text: You thrive on the blood of innocents, hag - I cannot let you live.

Victim_001_Dead_11.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_Dead_11.text: I'd the Bite... Laduguer's Bite... sickness worse than... death.

Victim_001_Dead_10.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_Dead_10.text: Hag turned me... to stone. Stopped the... spread.

Victim_001_Dead_8.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_Dead_8.text: Got sick... had to leave home... leave my children...

Victim_001_Dead_3.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_Dead_3.text: ... wonder what... they look like now...

Victim_001_Dead_6.speaker: Player
Victim_001_Dead_6.text: What can you tell me about the hag?

Victim_001_Dead_13.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_Dead_13.text: She'll give you more... than you bargained... for...

Victim_001_Dead_5.speaker: Narrator
Victim_001_Dead_5.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Victim_001_Dead_16.speaker: Narrator
Victim_001_Dead_16.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

HagBegsForMercy_42.text: Wait! Argh. Wait just a tick.
HagBegsForMercy_42.context: NodeContext: You're on the brink of being defeated in the fight and you've stopped it - preparing to beg for your life with a new deal. You're breathless and in pain, fighting to regain control.

HagBegsForMercy_56.text: Killing me is a waste of time - I'll find a way to return. Always have, always will.
HagBegsForMercy_56.context: NodeContext: little breathy from the fight, coldly determined in the second line

HagBegsForMercy_86.text: But it's... unpleasant. So how about we be civilised about this, hmm? I have something you want.
HagBegsForMercy_86.context: NodeContext: wincing at the thought in the first line, turning on the charm in the second, trying to regain control

HagBegsForMercy_57.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_57.text: What I want is Mayrina - alive and free.

HagBegsForMercy_44.speaker: Mayrina
HagBegsForMercy_44.text: Don't let her take me. Please.
HagBegsForMercy_44.context: NodeContext: Trying not to cry - pleading with the player

HagBegsForMercy_12.text: Shut it. You owe me a babe, girl. And I'll take it - whether you like it or not.

HagBegsForMercy_77.text: Let me leave with the girl, and I'll give you power.
HagBegsForMercy_77.context: NodeContext: Hag saleswoman mode is in full swing. Charismatic and enticing.

HagBegsForMercy_107.text: You want to be stronger? Tougher? Smarter? Done! Anything is possible. (Ability Score +1)

HagBegsForMercy_88.text: Just let me keep the girl and her babe.

HagBegsForMercy_95.speaker: Lae'zel
HagBegsForMercy_95.text: A simple trade? More deception. Take her head.

HagBegsForMercy_70.speaker: Shadowheart
HagBegsForMercy_70.text: If her powers were worth anything, we wouldn't have beaten her. Finish this.

HagBegsForMercy_62.speaker: Karlach
HagBegsForMercy_62.text: Please! She's dreaming if she thinks we'd leave Mayrina here.

HagBegsForMercy_35.speaker: Astarion
HagBegsForMercy_35.text: Trading some whelp we just met for impossible power? It's a fine deal.

HagBegsForMercy_43.speaker: Wyll
HagBegsForMercy_43.text: Don't you dare take the offer. No power is worth such a cruel price.

HagBegsForMercy_19.speaker: Gale
HagBegsForMercy_19.text: Not only would this be a vile deal, it would be folly to trust a hag's gifts.

HagBegsForMercy_82.context: NodeContext: Commanding tone. It's the player's decision - the girl or the power.

HagBegsForMercy_26.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_26.text: If you want to live, hand over Mayrina and this power. Right now.

HagBegsForMercy_81.context: NodeContext: Player has you beat. They've bested you in a deal and you're PISSED.

HagBegsForMercy_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: She yanked a clump of hair from her skull. Grinning, she tossed it to the player. NodeContext: Bitter and beaten. She yanked a clump of hair from her skull. Grinning, she tossed it to the player.

HagBegsForMercy_38.text: I'll not soon forget this, sweetness. You have my word.
HagBegsForMercy_38.context: NodeContext: A threat as you vanish. Menacing and cruel.

HagBegsForMercy_75.context: NodeContext: You've offered the player a deal and they've asked for double. You won't budge on your original offer. You're pissed they would even suggest it. Each word said with FORCE and purpose. Perhaps a pause between each one.

HagBegsForMercy_60.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_60.text: No good can come of this. Let Mayrina go.

HagBegsForMercy_61.text: Gods turn your goody soul to shite.
HagBegsForMercy_61.context: NodeContext: Player has chosen to save the girl. You are not impressed. Rolled eyes, almost 'tsking.'

HagBegsForMercy_33.speaker: Mayrina
HagBegsForMercy_33.context: NodeContext: Afraid and relieved - the player just saved your life

HagBegsForMercy_18.text: Not that it matters - I'll find another just as plump an' ripe.
HagBegsForMercy_18.context: NodeContext: This is the salt in the wound as you flee and an extremely shitty thing to say. It doesn't matter that the 'hero' saved the girl - you'll keep hurting people.

HagBegsForMercy_34.speaker: Mayrina
HagBegsForMercy_34.text: But the deal... What about my husband? What happens to him?

HagBegsForMercy_65.text: Deal's off, you dumb cow! And you've her to thank for it.

HagBegsForMercy_20.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_20.text: Keep the girl. I'll take the power.

HagBegsForMercy_50.context: NodeContext: Big smile - the player has taken your deal.

HagBegsForMercy_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: *She yanked a clump of hair from her skull. Grinning, she tossed it to the player. NodeContext: Player has agreed to take the power and let you leave with the girl. You're thrilled - you've won.

HagBegsForMercy_5.text: Deal's on, girl. And you're not leaving my side 'til you deliver.

HagBegsForMercy_99.text: Bollocks to luck. It's only the deal that counts.

HagBegsForMercy_30.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_30.text: Get out of here before I change my mind.

HagBegsForMercy_112.text: Aw. Don't act like you won't miss me.

HagBegsForMercy_108.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_108.text: If I ever see you again, you'll be fertilising this swamp.

HagBegsForMercy_97.text: If I ever see you again, you'll have a tentacle for a tongue.

HagBegsForMercy_69.text: I can set up shop elsewhere. People always need 'lotions and potions'.

HagBegsForMercy_87.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_87.text: I think a dead hag is the answer here.

HagBegsForMercy_73.text: Fine. Have it your way! I'll rip your throat out yet, you little bollocks.
HagBegsForMercy_73.context: NodeContext: Combat is about to happen. Player has threatened you. You're enraged as you prepare to attack.

HagBegsForMercy_100.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_100.text: My reinforcements are nearly here. Give me the girl and the power and they'll spare you.

HagBegsForMercy_59.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_59.text: I'll have it all. Or I'll just settle for your life.

HagBegsForMercy_63.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_63.text: I know a beaten opponent when I see one. Give me the power and the girl, and I'll let you live.

HagBegsForMercy_6.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_6.text: Such power will let me better serve the Spider Queen. Give it to me.

HagBegsForMercy_46.speaker: Player

HagBegsForMercy_17.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_17.text: In the name of Eilistraee, release the girl and leave this place - never to return.

HagBegsForMercy_47.text: Argh, nothing irks me more than a goody-two-shoes drow. Fine.

HagBegsForMercy_51.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_51.text: Neither. But a hag's head would make an excellent trophy.

HagBegsForMercy_96.text: Tch. Tough talk from the oversized lemon. But fine. Have it your way. I'll rip out your throat!
HagBegsForMercy_96.context: NodeContext: Combat is about to happen. Player has threatened you. You're insulting them - a cruel blow - as you prepare to attack.

HagBegsForMercy_53.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_53.text: You're a vile, monstrous creature. There is no bargain for you but death.

HagBegsForMercy_52.text: Tch. Doesn't it ever get lonely? Up on that high horse of yours?
HagBegsForMercy_52.context: NodeContext: Combat is about to happen. Player has threatened you. You're insulting them - a cruel blow - as you prepare to attack.

HagBegsForMercy_22.text: But have it your way. Tell your precious little god I say hello... after I rip out your throat!

HagBegsForMercy_80.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_80.text: There's no choice to make. A corrupting force like you has to be destroyed.

HagBegsForMercy_45.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_45.text: I'll bathe in your blood as I offer your death up in prayer.

HagBegsForMercy_111.text: Well, that doesn't sound very hygienic.

HagBegsForMercy_31.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy_31.text: You're a stain upon this land, but I will cleanse it.

HagBegsForMercy_23.text: Tch. I hear blood and guts make excellent fertiliser. Let's spread you over the soil and see, you little bollocks.
HagBegsForMercy_23.context: NodeContext: Combat is about to happen. Player has threatened you. You're insulting them - a cruel blow - as you prepare to attack.

HagBegsForMercy_83.speaker: Player

HagBegsForMercy_41.text: Tch. Fine. Have it your way. I'll use that thick skull of yours as a stewing pot!
HagBegsForMercy_41.context: NodeContext: Combat is about to happen. Player has threatened you. You're insulting them - a cruel blow - as you prepare to attack.

HagBegsForMercy_71.text: I've never been called a scourge before, you flirt. But sweet words won't get you out of this one!

HagBegsForMercy_94.text: I knew I liked you, dearie.
HagBegsForMercy_94.context: NodeContext: Big smile, you think you have the player where you want.

HagBegsForMercy_91.speaker: Player

HagBegsForMercy_14.text: Now, petal, there's... there's no need for such talk.

HagBegsForMercy_103.text: I can give you power. Anything you want!

HagBegsForMercy_21.text: You want to be stronger? Tougher? Smarter? Done! Just let me go. (Ability Score +1)

HagBegsForMercy_8.speaker: Astarion

HagBegsForMercy_105.context: NodeContext: Big smile - you're sure the player will take your deal.

HagBegsForMercy_27.speaker: Player

HagBegsForMercy_104.text: Why, sweetness. You're either a saint or an eejit.

HagBegsForMercy_74.speaker: Player

HagBegsForMercy_29.speaker: Player

HagBegsForMercy_110.speaker: Wyll

HagBegsForMercy_85.speaker: Gale

HagBegsForMercy_32.speaker: Player

HagBegsForMercy_102.text: Hold your horses - just hear me out.

HagBegsForMercy_78.speaker: Player

HagBegsForMercy_92.text: You wound me, sweetie. My offer will put that little pact of yours to shame.
